lyrics.lyrics: Let me play up there with those stars
Let me see what life is like
In other words, hold my hand
In other words, darling, kiss me
Let me swing for ever more
You are all I long for
In other words, please be true
In other words, I love you
You fill my heart with song
Let me sing for ever more because
All I long for and adore
In other words, please be true
In other words, in other words

lyricsAnnotations.lyrics:
Fill my heart with song
 And let me sing forevermore
 You are all I long for
 All I worship and adore
 In other words, please be true
 In other words, I love you
annotation:
Kaye Ballard recorded this song first. Her recording was released by Decca Records in 1954.  Billboard (magazine) said that it was “A love song sung with feeling…” in a brief review published on 8 May 1954.



The girl fills him with a joy he has never had in his life before. She fills him with love and other powerful emotions he has never had and it makes him happy. He longs only to be her one and only, not her to be his. It’s true love.

lyricsAnnotations.lyrics:
And let me see what spring is like
 On a-Jupiter and Mars
annotation:
Frank Sinatra’s 1964 recording was played by the astronauts of Apollo 10 on their lunar-orbital mission and again on the moon itself by the astronaut Buzz Aldrin during the Apollo 11 landing.

https://youtu.be/UITwhy5-Vas

sections.explanation: The first verse begins with 'Fly me to the moon', introducing the romantic and dreamy theme of the song.
The chorus begins with 'Fill my heart with song', increasing the intensity of the song.
The second verse commences, mirroring the sentiments of the first verse.
The second chorus echoes the sentiments of the first chorus, reiterating the song's theme.

song_start.explanation: The song starts with a soft, jazzy instrumental introduction.

song_end.explanation: The song concludes with a diminuendo, emphasizing the final lyrics 'I love you!'
